parameter_estimation
Class Rosenbrock

java.lang.Object
  parameter_estimation.Paths
      parameter_estimation.Rosenbrock

public class Rosenbrock
extends Paths

Rosenbrock algorithm developed by Nick Vandewiele, February 2010
inspired by B. Debrabandere's fortran implementation
adopted from "Computational Techniques for Chemical Engineers", by H.H. Rosenbrock and C. Storey
Ghent University
The Rosenbrock type performs the actual parameter optimization. Function type is called to calculate the Sum of Squared Errors (SSQ)

 double[][] set_new_basis(double[] dd, double[][] bbasis)
          If successes have been found in multiple directions, this means that a new basis should be chosen
Basis vectors should be chosen in the joint direction of the successes
This method sets a new basis, but the actual implementation is still a mystery to me
 void update_chemistry_input(double[] beta_new)
          plug new parameter guesses into the chemkin chemistry input file (usually chem.inp)
write new update chem.inp file
return the chemistry input filename
WARNING: method supposes a pre-conditioned chem.inp file, processed by ChemClean and with TD inside chem.inp!!!

update_chemistry_input

public void update_chemistry_input(double[] beta_new)
                            throws java.io.IOException
plug new parameter guesses into the chemkin chemistry input file (usually chem.inp)
write new update chem.inp file
return the chemistry input filename
WARNING: method supposes a pre-conditioned chem.inp file, processed by ChemClean and with TD inside chem.inp!!!

java.io.IOException

basis_init

public double[][] basis_init(double[][] bbasis)
Initialization of the basis, taking unit vectors in every direction of the parameters

set_new_basis

public double[][] set_new_basis(double[] dd,
                                double[][] bbasis)
If successes have been found in multiple directions, this means that a new basis should be chosen
Basis vectors should be chosen in the joint direction of the successes
This method sets a new basis, but the actual implementation is still a mystery to me

gramschmidt

public double[][] gramschmidt(double[][] bbasis)
Parameters:
basis -
Returns:
An orthonormal basis is derived and returned from the matrix basis using the Gram-Schmidt algorithm

reset_flag

public int[] reset_flag(int[] fflag)
Parameters:
flag -
Returns:
all flags are set to 2, meaning i.e. no success has been achieved in direction i
